# Strayl

**Strayl** is an AI-powered development platform. You describe what you want to build — Strayl's AI agent writes the code, runs it in an isolated sandbox, and deploys it to a live URL. No manual setup. No infrastructure overhead.

## Overview

- [What is Strayl?](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs.md)
- [Quickstart](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/quickstart.md)

## Platform

- [Platform Overview](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/overview.md): A high-level look at Chat, Code View, Deployments, and Databases.
- [Projects](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/projects.md): Creating, importing, and managing projects.
- [AI Agent](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/agent.md): How the AI agent works — models, streaming, tool use, and context.
- [Plan Mode](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/plan-mode.md): Review and approve the agent's plan before it writes any code.
- [Changes](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/changes.md): Stacked diffs — review, merge, and roll back changes.
- [Code View](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/code-view.md): Browse and edit your project's file tree directly in the browser.
- [Deployments](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/deployments.md): Deploy to a live URL, manage custom domains, and roll back.
- [Databases](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/databases.md): Neon Postgres — provisioning, branching, and connecting.
- [Environment Variables](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/environment-vars.md): Managing secrets and environment variables.
- [Team & Roles](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/platform/team.md): Inviting collaborators and managing permissions.

## CLI

- [CLI Overview](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/cli/overview.md): Installing and configuring the Strayl CLI.
- [Authentication](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/cli/authentication.md): `st login`, `st logout`, `st whoami`.
- [Projects](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/cli/projects.md): `st init`, `st link`, `st clone`, `st status`.
- [Git Workflow](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/cli/git-workflow.md): `st push`, `st pull`, `st promote`.
- [Changes](https://docs.strayl.dev/docs/cli/changes.md): `st changes`, `st change <id>`.
